page.title: 07TILESHED PIGGERY,EAST BOLDON
page.content:
{Tileshed Piggery}lies one mile to the south of the Whiteleas council housing eastate near East Boldon.
It covers 7 acres and is owned by Mr.Dixon, who has been a pig farmer for 59 years. The piggery at the moment has 250 animals. Mr.Dixon breeds them for pork. The pigs are fed on swill and bread. The swill is collected from the kitchens of local schools and restaurants in Sunderland. It has to be heated in a special boiler to a temperature of 93 degrees Celsius. This kills germs in the swill and prevents the pigs catching disease. Mr.Dixon uses{1000 gallons}of swill a day. When the pigs weigh{110lbs (50kg)} deadweight he sells them to the local abbatoir.
